content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, and Chandler are sitting on the couch and chair as Phoebe is getting coffee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m having dinner with my dad tomorrow night, do you wanna come?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure. Yeah, he’s kinda sexy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, no, I’ll be there too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay so, we’ll just come up with some kind of signal if it’s going well you can take off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Phoebe! I just need you there for support. I haven’t told him I’m pregnant yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Cause I know he’s gonna flip out and I hate it when he’s angry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Rachel, this is all so ‘Papa don’t preach.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What Phoebe? Wait! One time he caught me smoking he said if he ever saw me doing that again he’d make me eat the entire pack.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Oh well, I will be there!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Gosh. I’m not gonna let that man make you eat your baby. (They both sit down by the rest of the gang and Phoebe recognizes a man by the window.) Oh. Hey! Who is that guy? I think I know him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you don’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No you don’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!!! Monica!! He’s the stripper from your bachelorette party!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Her what?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your secret bachelorette party…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You had a bachelorette party?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She untied his G-string with her teeth. (Pause) Somebody stop me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought we weren’t gonna have bachelor/bachelorette parties! Y’know, we agreed that it was a silly tradition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s a grand tradition!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, they surprised me. There was nothing I could do!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you could’ve untied it with your hands.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is so unfair! The one thing I wanted to do was throw my best friend a bachelor party, but no, I wasn’t allowed to. All I got was a stupid steak dinner!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You went home with the waitress.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, that was a pretty good night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me! You know that the two pillars of marriage are openness and honesty!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ugh, I knew giving you that book was gonna come back and bite me in the ass!

content.description: A Restaurant, Rachel and Phoebe are having dinner with Dr. Green, and everyone is looking at the menu.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: How about I order everyone the Moroccan chicken?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I-I don’t eat meat.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: It’s chicken.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I don’t eat that either.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: I’ll never understand you lesbians. (To Rachel) So baby, tell me…what is new with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well actually umm…

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Your ’74 Lafite sir.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: ’74?! I ordered the ’75! That’s a magnificent wine! The ’74 is sewage! Why would you bring me sewage?! (The waiter’s dumbfounded) Is that a hard question? Are you an idiot? Is that why you’re a waiter?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: This is why I told the manager I wouldn’t wait on you tonight! (Runs off.)

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Oh come on! Don’t be such a baby! (Goes after him)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: In case you didn’t notice, that is a scary man.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s right though, the ’74 is absolute piss.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This was such a huge mistake. I can’t tell him Phoebe. I can’t, I can’t, I can’t, I can’t…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No it’s okay, this is what’s gonna happen. I’m gonna wait a couple years and then the baby will tell him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why, so he can get mad at the baby?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, that is the…baby’s problem. (Dr. Green returns.) Oh, everything okay with the waiter?

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: I have no idea, I went to the bathroom. So sweetie, you were starting to tell me what is uh, what is new with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well… Umm, I got TiVo .

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: What’s TiVo ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s slang for pregnant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Are you really pregnant?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well uh, yes and no. Except not no. So to sum it up, yeah.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Who is the father? Oh no! Please don’t tell me it’s her! (Points at Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it’s Ross. It’s Ross. You like Ross. (He just shakes his head.) Oh daddy, I hope you’re okay with all of this. I mean think about it, this is a good thing. You’re gonna—This is your first grandchild! You’re gonna be a poppy!

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: That’s true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Poppy. (To Phoebe) Oh, I’m gonna be a poppy. (Stops laughing) So when is the wedding?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: The wedding! There’s going to be a wedding. Young lady, don’t you sit there and tell me my first grandchild is going to be a bastard! (Rachel pauses) Rachel Karen Green, tell me there is gonna be a wedding!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: February 2 nd !
(Dr. Green exhales in relief.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are reading a magazine and Ross is chatting with Mona.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: So it was really cool seeing you lecture today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh thanks. Although it kinda seemed like you were falling asleep there a little.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh no-no, I-I had my eyes closed so I could concentrate and y’know take it all in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, a lot of my students do that.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: So, I gotta get going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I-I’ll see you tonight.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, bye.
(They kiss and she starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh hey, thanks again for showing me your semi-precious stone collection. It was amazing! (She leaves.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My God! You must be good in bed!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh, you and Mona, been a while now. How’s it going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, it’s good. It’s going good. I mean, we get along great. She’s, she’s so…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hot?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I was gonna say sweet, but yeah-huh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s okay with Rachel and the baby?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I…I haven’t actually told her yet. I don’t want to scare her off, y’know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you have to honest with her! Otherwise you may think that you’re going down the same path, but you’re really going down different ones.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna take that book and beat you to death with it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You are gonna love me so much! I felt really bad about the whole bachelorette party thing, so tonight you’re gonna have a bachelor party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I got this number from this guy at work and I hired a stripper to come dance for you. Am I going in the wife hall of fame or what?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey! That’s crazy! I don’t want you to get me a stripper…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you let the lady talk?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Come on, it’ll be fun! It’ll make me feel so much better.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I appreciate it, but uh, it’s a little creepy. Y’know? I’m not a bachelor anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So don’t think of it as a bachelor party, think of it as a…a two month anniversary present.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, one year is paper, but two months is lapdance! (Joey nods his agreement.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please! I feel so bad! Just watch the hot woman get naked!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right fine! But I’m only doing this for you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. All right, now who else do you want to invite?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, no-no-no just Ross. Ross and Joey is embarrassing enough.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh actually, sorry I can’t even make it. I’m seeing Mona again tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I understand: who would cancel an actual date to go to a fake bachelor party?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry I gotta cancel tonight baby…

content.description: The Restaurant, dinner has ended and Phoebe and Rachel are talking. Dr. Green is not at the table.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry I won’t be able to make it to your imaginary wedding, but I’m really busy that day. Yeah, I already have a unicorn baptism and a leprechaun bar mitzvah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. I know. I panicked, I panicked. I didn’t want him to start yelling at me like I was some ’74 Latour.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Lafite. The ’74 Latour is actually drinking quite nicely.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right here he comes. I’m gonna do this, I’m gonna tell him, I’m gonna be strong.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: I just called a friend of mine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: I think I may be able to book The Plaza on short notice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! The Plaza ?!! Oh daddy!! (Hugs him and Phoebe glares at her.) Right. Daddy, I need to talk to you. Please, sit down.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: What is it sweetie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There’s not gonna be a wedding. Ross and I are not getting married.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry daddy.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: I don’t believe this!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh now daddy, stay calm. Please.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Stay calm?!! How do you expect me to stay calm?! This is unacceptable Rachel! And I wanna know why?!! Is it because that punk Ross won’t marry you?! That’s it! Is that it?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Yes, he says I’m damaged goods.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler’s bachelor party has begun, what there is of it, with only Joey (wearing a gold paper top hat) and Chandler (wearing what appears to be a Burger King paper crown) enjoying a nice product placement of Budweisers on ice.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you uh, nervous about getting married?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, look let’s pretend it’s a real bachelor party. Okay? Y’know? Before your wedding. Come on, it’ll be fun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. I can’t believe tomorrow’s the big day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How does it feel knowing you’re never gonna be with another woman again huh? Knowing you’re gonna have to wake up to the same face everyday until you finally have the sweet release of death.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, this is more fun.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s her! Okay, come on! (They go over and open the door.)

content.speaker: Stripper
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi. (Joey blows on a noisemaker.)

content.speaker: Stripper
content.text: So which one of you lucky boys is Chandler?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, that-that’s-that’s me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey Tribbiani, a big fan.

content.speaker: Stripper
content.text: So is that a bedroom? (Points to the guestroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, yeah right over there.

content.speaker: Stripper
content.text: All right, whenever you’re ready. (She goes into the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was weird.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why-why would she go in the bedroom?

content.speaker: Stripper
content.text: I’m waiting.
(They both slowly enter the bedroom and quickly walk back out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So she’s a…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that’s one naked hooker!

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, Ross and Mona are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I love your place! Where is this guy from? (A statue from the top of his apothecary table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh that’s an eighteenth century Indian artifact from Calcutta.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh wow! So, you’re more than just dinosaurs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So much more.
(They start making out and she kicks the eighteenth century Indian artifact from Calcutta off of his apothecary table from the days of yore and the magical city of White Plains.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! I’m so sorry!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw forget it, it’s from Pier One . (There’s an angry knock on the door.) Sorry. (Goes and opens the door to an irate Dr. Green.)

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: You think you can knock up my daughter and then not marry her?! I’m gonna kill you!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know this is actually not a great time for me.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: So? Come on! Explain yourself Geller! First you get my Rachel pregnant!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: You got Rachel pregnant?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who did?!

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: You did!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes, yes I did. (To Mona) But-but it was, it was just a one night thing. It meant nothing.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Oh? Really? That’s what my daughter means to you? Nothing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No sir umm, she means a lot to me. I mean, I care—I-I love Rachel.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh but not that way. I mean…I mean I’m not in love with her. I love her like a, like a friend.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Oh really? That’s how treat a friend? You get her in trouble and then refuse to marry her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! I offered to marry her!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Wh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But I didn’t want to.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: Well why not? So you can spend your time with this tramp?!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Tramp?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. Dr. Green, Mona. Mona, Dr. Green.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Joey are discussing what to do about the now naked hooker in the guestroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe there is a naked hooker in there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait! Wait! Maybe she’s a hooker and a stripper, but she got confused about what she’s supposed to do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could be. I mean technically she did strip, we just, we just missed it. (Walks towards the bedroom.) Ma’am, are you also a stripper?

content.speaker: Hooker
content.text: Uh, no. But I could pretend to strip, but that’s gonna cost extra. Okay, here’s the extras, handcuffs, spanking… (Chandler grunts for her not to continue and Joey pulls him back into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe Monica’s playing a joke on ya. Y’know? Getting her own husband a hooker, that’s pretty funny.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is funny, maybe for my birthday she’ll murder someone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet Ross was in on it too. I mean he was conveniently busy.

content.speaker: Hooker
content.text: Do you mind if I smoke in here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh actually, I’d rather you…Yeah, go ahead. We’re gonna have to burn that room down anyway.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: How could you have kept all of this from me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was going to tell you, but…

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: But what?! You figured you’d get what you wanted and then dump her like you dumped Rachel!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! I did not dump Rachel! (To Mona) Nor are we still together. (The phone rings and Ross goes to answer it, only he’s trapped behind the apothecary table by Dr. Green.) Can I just… (Dr. Green glares at him.) Why don’t we just let the machine get that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross. It’s Joey. There’s a hooker over here and we thought maybe you’d know something about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! No! No! No! I-I-I-I—I need to, I need to lie down.

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, she’s cooking as one of her waiters, Stu, comes over to talk to her.

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: So, tonight’s the night of the big bachelor party?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Hey! Thanks for getting me that girl’s number.

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: No problem. So who’s the party for?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My husband.

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: You hired your husband a hooker?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s a stripper.

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: No, she’s a hooker.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that, is that what they call strippers sometimes?

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: When they’re hookers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God Stu! I-I can’t believe you did this! Now are you absolutely sure she’s a hooker?

content.speaker: Stu
content.text: Either that or she’s just the best, most expensive date I ever had.
(Monica runs out.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Joey and Chandler are still deciding what to do about the hooker.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe she meant to get you a hooker.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why would she do that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe she wants you to learn something. Huh? Now is there anything you’re really bad at y’know, sexually?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is the worst bachelor party ever!

content.speaker: Hooker
content.text: What’s taking you boys so long?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In a minute!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In a minute? What’s gonna happen in a minute?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right maybe-maybe you should just ask her to leave.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! It’s your bachelor party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which is why you should do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to. You do it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You do it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right Rock, Paper, Scissors who has to tell the whore to leave! (Joey smirks.) What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I miss this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think we’ve actually done this before!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I-I miss hanging out with you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well we…we still hang out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not like we used to. Remember? You and me used to be inseparable. Y’know now it’s like…things are different.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well y’know, things are different. I’m…I’m married now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sure—And hey, don’t get me wrong, I am so happy for you guys. I just…I miss…hanging out…just-just us, y’know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I miss that too. I tell you what; from now on we’ll make time to hang out with each other.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it. Come here. (They hug and are observed by the hooker.)

content.speaker: Hooker
content.text: Oh God! Listen, I am this close to robbing you guys. (Does the close sign.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s a hooker! She’s a hooker! She’s a… (Stops as she sees her.) Hi! Uh, we spoke on the phone. (Goes and shakes the hooker’s hand.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel and Phoebe are at the counter as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So your dad dropped by. He’s a pleasant man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’d better go. (She goes and sits down in the La-Z-Boy E-cliner 3000 , the chair that Sit magazine called chair of the year, and they both look at her.) Just over here: I don’t want to miss the fight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross I’m so sorry. Okay. I-I will promise I will straighten this out with him tomorrow in person, or via e-mail.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t care about your dad! I care about Mona! She was there and now she’s totally freaked out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh okay, I’ll fix that to. What’s her e-mail address?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I promise. I’ll fix this. I swear. I’ll-I’ll-I’ll-I’ll talk to her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s it?! You call that a fight? Come on! “We were on a break!” “No we weren’t!” What happened to you two?!

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, Ross is opening the door to Mona. Rachel is there as well.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you so much for coming back over.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh good, you’re here. Yeah, and I was worried that it was going to be uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know Mona, just hear me out. First of all, I’m so sorry about my father yelling at you, but I heard you totally held your own. You’re gonna have to tell me how you did that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Focus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Um…But—Okay, yes Ross and I used to date. And yes we are gonna have a baby. But we are definitely not getting back together.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: How can I be sure on that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh we just—we drove each other crazy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean he was possessive, he was jealous, he could never just let the little things go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Trying to date this woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right! But, none of that compared to how kind and-and how gentle and thoughtful he is. (Rubbing his shoulder.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Probably shouldn’t touch me.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Y’know, I-I-I just…I don’t want to get in the middle of something so complicated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I get it, but Mona, what relationship is not complicated? I mean we all have our baggage! You must too! Why else would you still be single? (Mona looks at her.) I am so gonna leave right now. (Ross opens the door for her and she leaves.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Should I leave this open for you too?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I’m not sure yet. Why didn’t you just tell me about all this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because what’s going on with Rachel has nothing to do with how I feel about you.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah? Well you still shoulda told me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know and I was going to, but I thought it was better that you heard it from Rachel’s father. Look I…I made a mistake, but it’s only because I really, really like you. Really!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay, I guess you can…close the door now. (He does so and they kiss.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Forgot my purse! (Sees them kissing.) Oh, you guys made up. (To Mona) He’s a good kisser isn’t he? (Ross goes to close the door on her.) I’m going! (Quickly leaves and Ross locks the door.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the bachelor party has ended and Monica is trying to explain herself to Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear I didn’t know she was a hooker! I mean wh—Did you let her smoke in here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Her ass print is still on your grandmother’s quilt, do you really want to talk about smoking?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? I’m gonna make this up to you. I promised you a stripper (turns on the radio), and you’re gonna get a stripper. (She starts to strip.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica! Wait!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Carry on.
(She does so by taking off her jacket seductively, only she has trouble getting one hand out and slams the jacket on the chair angrily to remove it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, these tennis shoes are so tight. I think I’ll take them off. (Goes to do so.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could you not narrate?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gotcha sailor. (Kicks one of her shoes off and it lands in the kitchen knocking something down, but she continues to strip.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is being yelled at by her dad over the phone, and he’s been going on for so long Rachel is holding the phone away from her ear and reading a book.

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: …just because you’re not in love with the guy you can’t…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, you told your dad the truth.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: About an hour ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wanna go see a movie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! (She gets up and sets the phone on the counter without hanging it up.) Bye daddy. (Phoebe and her leave.)

content.speaker: Dr. Green
content.text: …there’s gonna be a wedding! (Joey enters from his room and goes to get a beer from the fridge.) That’s unacceptable Rachel! What the hell does love have to do with it anyway?! There are more important things in a marriage other than love! (Joey hears something and looks around for the source.) …constantly thinking about things! You have to think about the consequences of your decision. (Joey finds that the sound is coming from the phone and puts it to his ear.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I do too think about the consequences of my decisions! (Listens) What gives you the right to… (Listens) Go to hell! (Hangs up the phone and opens the fridge.) Stupid guy on my phone.
